items.title: The Body Keeps the Score
items.author: Bessel van der Kolk
items.description: A pioneering researcher transforms our understanding of trauma and offers a bold new paradigm for healing in this New York Times bestseller. Trauma is a fact of life; veterans and their families deal with the painful aftermath of combat.

items.title: The Girl on the Train
items.author: Paula Hawkins
items.description: Rachel Watson, an alcoholic reeling from a recent divorce, takes the same commuter train every morning and night. Every day she rattles down the track, flashes past a stretch of cozy suburban homes, and stops at the signal that allows her to daily watch the same couple breakfasting on their deck. She’s even started to feel like she knows them. 'Jess and Jason,' she calls them. Their life—as she sees it—is perfect. Not unlike the life she recently lost.

items.title: Atomic Habits
items.author: James Clear
items.description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones. James Clear presents a practical framework for improving every day by focusing on tiny, incremental changes that compound into remarkable results over time.

items.title: Dune
items.author: Frank Herbert
items.description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, Dune is the story of the boy Paul Atreides, heir to a noble family tasked with ruling an inhospitable world where the only thing of value is the 'spice' melange, a drug capable of extending life and enhancing consciousness.

items.title: Clean Code
items.author: Robert C. Martin
items.description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn’t have to be that way.

items.title: Becoming
items.author: Michelle Obama
items.description: In a life filled with meaning and accomplishment, Michelle Obama has emerged as one of the most iconic and compelling women of our era. As First Lady of the United States of America—the first African American to serve in that role—she helped create the most welcoming and inclusive White House in history.

items.title: Clean Code
items.author: Robert C. Martin
items.description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn’t have to be that way.

items.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
items.author: Harper Lee
items.description: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it, To Kill A Mockingbird became both an instant bestseller and a critical success when it was first published in 1960.

items.title: Clean Code
items.author: Robert C. Martin
items.description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn’t have to be that way.

items.title: Quiet: The Power of Introverts
items.author: Susan Cain
items.description: In a culture that dramatically undervalues introverts, this book argues that we lose out on their extraordinary talents. Cain charts the rise of the Extrovert Ideal and explores how deeply it has come to permeate our culture.

items.title: Clean Code
items.author: Robert C. Martin
items.description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn’t have to be that way.

items.title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
items.author: Brandon Sanderson
items.description: For a thousand years the ash fell and no flowers bloomed. For a thousand years the Skaa slaved in misery and lived in fear. For a thousand years the Lord Ruler, the 'Sliver of Infinity,' reigned with absolute power and ultimate terror, divinely invincible. Then, when hope was so long lost that not even its memory remained, a terribly scarred, heart-broken half-Skaa rediscovered it in the depths of the Lord Ruler's most hellish prison.

items.title: Man's Search for Meaning
items.author: Viktor E. Frankl
items.description: A profound and deeply moving book, 'Man's Search for Meaning' is both a memoir of psychiatrist Viktor Frankl's experiences in Nazi concentration camps and an introduction to his therapeutic philosophy, known as logotherapy. Frankl argues that the primary human drive is not pleasure but the pursuit of what we find meaningful.

items.title: The Hunger Games
items.author: Suzanne Collins
items.description: In the ruins of a place once known as North America lies the nation of Panem, a shining Capitol surrounded by twelve outlying districts. The Capitol is harsh and cruel and keeps the districts in line by forcing them all to send one boy and one girl between the ages of twelve and eighteen to participate in the annual Hunger Games, a fight to the death on live TV.

items.title: Educated: A Memoir
items.author: Tara Westover
items.description: An unforgettable memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University. Tara Westover was seventeen the first time she set foot in a classroom.

items.title: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat
items.author: Oliver Sacks
items.description: In his most extraordinary book, 'the man who illuminated the many mysteries of the mind' (The New York Times) and the 'poet laureate of contemporary medicine' (The Guardian) recounts the case histories of patients lost in the bizarre, apparently inescapable world of neurological disorders.

items.title: Clean Code
items.author: Robert C. Martin
items.description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn’t have to be that way.

items.title: Clean Code
items.author: Robert C. Martin
items.description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn’t have to be that way.

items.title: Clean Code
items.author: Robert C. Martin
items.description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn’t have to be that way.

items.title: Project Hail Mary
items.author: Andy Weir
items.description: Ryland Grace is the sole survivor on a desperate, last-chance mission—and if he fails, humanity and the earth itself will perish. Except that right now, he doesn't know that. He can't even remember his own name, let alone the nature of his assignment or how to complete it.

items.title: Project Hail Mary
items.author: Andy Weir
items.description: Ryland Grace is the sole survivor on a desperate, last-chance mission—and if he fails, humanity and the earth itself will perish. Except that right now, he doesn't know that. He can't even remember his own name, let alone the nature of his assignment or how to complete it.

items.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
items.author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas
items.description: The Pragmatic Programmer cuts through the increasing specialization and technicalities of modern software development to examine the core process—taking a requirement and producing working, maintainable code that delights its users.

items.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
items.author: Douglas Adams
items.description: Seconds before the Earth is demolished to make way for a galactic freeway, Arthur Dent is plucked off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect, a researcher for the revised edition of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy who, for the last fifteen years, has been posing as an out-of-work actor.
